programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Josh Allen ran for two scores in the first quarter and threw two touchdown passes in the second half, leading the Buffalo Bills to a 48-42 victory Sunday that snapped the Detroit Lions ' franchise-record 11-game winning streak.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Bryce Young passed for three touchdowns, ran for two scores and led a 70-yard drive capped by Miles Sanders' 1-yard TD run on the opening possession of overtime to give Carolina a 44-38 win over Atlanta.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Stafford passed for 320 yards and hit Puka Nacua for a 19-yard touchdown with 1:54 to play, and the Rams overcame Allen's three TD passes and three TD runs to snap the Bills' seven-game winning streak with a 44-42 victory Sunday.

programme.title: TUF 10 Finale: TUF 10 Finale
programme.desc: The Ultimate Fighter: Heavyweights Finale saw the colossal collision between finalists Brendan 'The Hybrid' Schaub and Roy 'Big Country' Nelson. Also in action, Jon Jones vs. Matt Hamill, Frankie Edgar vs. Matt Veach, and the Octagon debut of Kimbo Slice.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: This season of the Ultimate Fighter features heavyweights including superstar street fighter Kimbo Slice. Coaches Rampage Jackson and Rashad Evans continually argue before picking teams. The first preliminary fight takes place.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Rampage scrambles to teach Kimbo new skills, while Team Rashad's Roy Nelson is deemed "uncoachable." Team Rampage picks the next matchup, pitting size against skills.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Street-fighter Kimbo Slice races to learn all he can before he takes on former IFL champion Roy 'Big Country' Nelson. And ex-NFL giant Marcus Jones causes trouble for Rampage

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: A fighter keels over at the house, giving Kimbo hope for a comeback. A member of Team Rashad spills the beans on their fight strategy. And, two more heavyweights do battle as Team Rashad tries to extend its winning streak.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Zak Jensen faces mockery at the house and problems in training. Matt Mitrione tests Rashad's patience with an on-again/off-again shoulder issue. Rampage looks to break his losing streak in the fifth preliminary fight.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Rampage's hazing of Darrill Schoonover reaches a boiling point. After relentless teasing at the house, the fighters bet on which day Zak Jensen will finally snap. An injury puts a fighter's future in doubt.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Rampage and Rashad nearly come to blows. Matt Mitrione continues to cause problems for his team by betraying one fighter and then lashing out at another. The 7th preliminary fight takes place.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Matt Mitrione and Scott Junk return from their fight, battered and bruised. In the last preliminary fight, Jones faces Mike Wessel. The quarterfinal matchups are announced.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Mitrione wavers on whether he can fight, sparking speculation that Kimbo will return to the Octagon. Justin Wren and Roy Nelson square off in the first quarterfinal fight.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Questions continue about whether Matt Mitrione will fight, prompting a visit from Dana. Kimbo battles an injury with hopes of returning as a replacement. Teammates Brendan Schaub and Jon Madsen face off in the second Quarterfinal fight.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Dana talks to Kimbo about replacing Mitrione. Marcus Jones unleashes his rage outside the cage. The last two quarterfinals are fought, followed by the semifinal announcements.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Sixteen Mixed Martial Artist fighters begin their journey towards fame and fortune. Coached by Ultimate Fighting Championship® legends, Randy Couture and Chuck Liddell, they will fight each other for two six-figure contracts in the UFC®.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Team Couture and team Liddell compete against each other in a test of strength, agility, and will. After several grueling challenges, two fighters are eliminated and sent home.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: In preparation for the premiere fight, a top contender struggles to lose 20 lbs in 24 hours, or face elimination. Two fighters christen the Octagon' with a classic battle of brute strength.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: After losing three of its members, Team Couture comes up with a new strategy to get a win. UFC® President Dana White throws a twist into the competition and two Middle Weights face off in the Octagon'.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: A night on the town for the team members turns violent. Contest rules are broken and the responsible fighters are reprimanded. Dana White and his coaches wrestle with how to settle the conflict.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Two contestants go into intensive training as they prepare for battle. Both teams rally around their fighters as the emotional conflict is settled in the Octagon'.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: After the much-anticipated Leben vs. Koscheck fight, people in the house are divided as ever. One of the teams is struggling with discord among its members. The Light Heavyweights have a match up that pits two of the strongest fighters against each other.

programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome back to episode #16 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show presented by Duke Cannon on TLN! The Quarterfinals are set! The Buckeyes have been eliminated. Did Ohio State get screwed with seeding? Although doogs is 1-0 in mollywop predictions, his bracket is not looking so good. The guys talk hot seats and if Duke & UNC are included. Notre dame seems to be peaking at the right time, and nobody seems to be slowing down CJ Kirst and Cornell. To round out the show the fellas play Start Bench Cut, fanbase edition.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Joey Spallina - Paul Carcaterra visits Syracuse, N.Y. to pull back the curtain on the biggest name in College Lacrosse: Joey Spallina. In this episode of THROUGH X, Spallina speaks on wearing the No. 22 at Syracuse, shares his goal to return the Orange to NCAA Championship glory, and shows you how to score his signature behind-the-back goal.

programme.title: 2025 Golden Stick Award Race
programme.desc: The Golden Stick Award is an award given to the player who accumulates the most scoring points throughout the Championship Series. In its history, the winner has been on the team who lost the championship title. This year we followed four of the best goal scorers in the world through their quest to be the first player to win the Championship Series trophy and the Golden Stick Award.

programme.title: TLN Facility Tours
programme.desc: Johns Hopkins & Clemson: Explore two top-tier lacrosse programs as TLN takes you inside their world-class facilities. Visit Johns Hopkins in Baltimore, MD, home to the legendary Blue Jays, and tour the iconic Cordish Lacrosse Center and Homewood Field. Then, head to Clemson, SC, for an exclusive look at the nation's premier women's lacrosse facilities.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.title: TLN Facility Tours
programme.desc: Johns Hopkins & Clemson: Explore two top-tier lacrosse programs as TLN takes you inside their world-class facilities. Then, head to Clemson, SC, for an exclusive look at the nation's premier women's lacrosse facilities.

programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome back to episode #16 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show presented by Duke Cannon on TLN! The Quarterfinals are set! The Buckeyes have been eliminated. programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $5,000 Seven Card Stud World Championship attracted 144 entrants and created a prize pool of $676,800. The WSOP bracelet and $221,000 first-place prize would look to be claimed by a savvy group of final tablists that included Marcel Luske, Jeff Lisandro, Joe Awada, Cory Zeidman, Dewey Tomko and John Juanda.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Phil Hellmuth headlines the $3,000 Pot-Limit Hold'em final table that includes Ram Vaswani and Phi Nguyen, while Gavin Griffin chases the title of youngest WSOP bracelet of all-time if he can emerge victorious. Who will win the $270,420 first-place prize and prestigious WSOP bracelet?

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The only straight Razz tournament of the 2004 WSOP would see a field of 195 players. Chris Bjorin, Hoyt Corkins, John Juanda, Howard Lederer, and Dutch Boyd all look to deny T.J. Cloutier his fifth WSOP bracelet as all eyes are on the $90,500 first-place prize.

programme.desc: Skylar works as a professional mistress hired by women for divorce leverage. When she finds herself falling for her target, Eric, she questions her career and her motives. programme.title: Say Less
programme.desc: Kimbra, a young woman in an abusive relationship with her boyfriend, Donta, is tragically murdered. The police search to find evidence to convict Donta, while her friends find the courage to bring her killer to justice.

programme.title: Queen Pin
programme.desc: When her boyfriend is killed, a woman quickly builds a team to take over his drug business, attracting dangerous local rivals along the way.

programme.title: Princess of the Trap House
programme.desc: When a local drug dealer is arrested and put in jail, he asks his daughter Diamond to run his operation. However it doesn't sit well with the crew. Diamond must get rid of the disloyal members of the crew before they take control of the operation.

programme.title: Office Secrets
programme.desc: As Alvin climbs to the top, he uncovers Mr. Leonard's dark secrets, setting off a chain reaction of suspense. Meanwhile, Victoria's vendetta adds a spicy twist to the mix, creating a captivating story where love, revenge, and corporate chaos collide in the most unexpected ways.

programme.title: The Frozen Hearts: A Love Story
programme.desc: A couple attempts to find their way back to each other after they suffer a traumatic loss. Can they do it? Or is it too late for them?

programme.title: Everything I Never Expected
programme.desc: Opposites attract when a spoiled bachelor and a broke college grad accidentally become roommates. Forced to cohabitate in a less-than-ideal apartment, they clash, prank, and eventually fall for each other. Life challenges and misunderstandings complicate their budding romance, but true love prevails.

programme.title: Liquid Dreams
programme.desc: The Dawkins brothers, navigating new careers and relationships, find their bond tested when a wild night of partying sets off a chain of events. Years after their initial adventures, they face fresh challenges that threaten to tear them apart.

programme.title: WOKE
programme.desc: A young college student, raised to her have biased opinions about the racial injustices, meets a young man he parents do not approve of.

programme.title: What She Wants
programme.desc: Vannaleese Poole is a street smart, businesswoman who uses her talents to get what she wants. In her quest for power, she falls for two men and becomes embroiled in a web of jealous and deceit.

programme.title: The Perfect Mother
programme.desc: Linda, a determined mother, faces the daily struggles of raising her son amidst the unpredictable presence of her husband. When a series of hardships push her to the edge, Linda's plea for assistance leads to Ahmad being taken into CPS custody.

programme.title: Shotlanta
programme.desc: Mozzy moves from Jamaica to Atlanta, rising in the drug trade to lift his family from poverty, but faces challenges that test his loyalty.

programme.title: Boyz for Life
programme.desc: Two detectives pursue an international criminal who stole Escobar's stash from the LAPD, swapping identities to protect a witness.

programme.title: Vanity Flaw
programme.desc: After losing a bet, Mallory dances at a strip club for one night, only to encounter a kidnapper with a dangerous obsession and a violent temper.

programme.title: The Last Days of an Escort
programme.desc: Kitty, a struggling escort, agrees to be documented for a film. Her roommate, Star, a more successful escort, reluctantly joins. A new client, Earl, changes their lives forever when he asks to see Kitty and Star together. Kitty's world becomes increasingly dangerous as she navigates the dark underworld of escorting.

programme.title: No Disrespect
programme.desc: Milk runs the streets efficiently in his father's absence. After 15 years in prison, his father, Bull, returns to claim what is rightfully his.

programme.title: Memoirs of a Vixen
programme.desc: Dewayne knows his wife will do anything to get him on board with having a baby and starting a family—even if it means becoming an adulteress.

programme.title: Mama Jones
programme.desc: Following a family tragedy, a grief-stricken matriarch becomes territorial when her son and his girlfriend come home with a surprise.

programme.title: Lethal Love Affair
programme.desc: Career driven Kyrstal has convinced herself that her job is more important than a relationship, until she meets Zoey.

programme.title: Kingsmen
programme.desc: Follows the story of the King family, a known crime syndicate. When their patriarch is killed, they fall under the wrath of a rival crime family, as well as the police. The four eldest brothers will do everything they can to protect their family.

programme.title: Finders Keepers
programme.desc: A struggling single father attempts a side hustle.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Derek Dirt Roberts is the top lieutenant for Big Boss, a criminal mastermind who becomes the city's most powerful organized criminal. When the two grow apart, Dirt hatches an elaborate plan to leave the organization.

programme.title: Grit
programme.desc: Brought together by their sister’s death, three estranged brothers enter into a pact to discover the truth about her murder and bring her justice.

programme.title: Deliveries From Eva
programme.desc: Finding he still has a fan, a disgraced music star forms an unlikely friendship with a delivery driver whose fandom grows into a dangerous obsession.

programme.title: Single Black Female
programme.desc: College freshman Rose quickly forms a bond with her new roommate, Max. But Max's intense loyalty soon takes a dangerous turn.

programme.title: Against All Odds
programme.desc: David, a young man reeling from his brother's death and his family's financial ruin, finds himself adrift. Rejected by his father, he turns to a local criminal for quick cash, only to find himself trapped in a dangerous web of deceit and violence. Now, David must fight to escape and protect his family before it's too late. The clock is ticking, and the stakes are higher than ever.

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqué, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.desc: Neville confronts Jackie about loaning Dan money; Darlene attempts to play matchmaker for Mark.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Mark's graduation approaches, he considers his relationship with his father; Louise plans a big graduation ceremony at the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie faces problems at the Lunch Box and must take advice from an unexpected guest.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky introduces Tyler to Beverly Rose, but she is skeptical of Tyler’s approach.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Bev experiences moments of clarity and reflection and asks Jackie to spend the day together in Chicago.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark adjusts to his first day of college as a commuter student.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene crashes Mark’s college trivia night to prove how smart she is.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene urges Ben to make some male friends as he feels anxious about turning 50.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The hardware store suffers a smash and grab and Dan and Jackie hold one of the culprits.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene seeks to be manager of food services at Mark’s college after feeling they could use some organization.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners relish national cheeseball day. Harris falls behind in her work at the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan is asked to write an article for a Hardware magazine, making Ben miss his days as a writer.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan is asked to write an article for a Hardware magazine, making Ben miss his days as a writer.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A fire at Ben’s hardware store causes a major setback for the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan achieves a major financial milestone, reconsidering his belief in the ‘Conners curse.’

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark takes on odd jobs, determined to find a way to pay for school.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A sudden turn of events forces the Conners to face their daily struggles in a way they never have before.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene is in for one surprise after another when David introduces his girlfriend, Blue (Juliette Lewis), and mentions that Mark and Harris will be spending the weekend with them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Halloween, the favorite time of year for the Conners, but an email from the school banning certain costumes, including Mark's, sets off an argument between Dan and Darlene.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Dan gets injured on the job covering D.J.'s vending machine route, the choice to sue the company could lead to D.J. getting fired.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Ben offers Mark free piano lessons, Darlene finds this as an opportunity to test his parenting skills. Meanwhile, Jackie throws Becky a baby shower.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Emilio's deportation, Jackie takes on a paternal role crafting a birth plan for Becky; Darlene navigates a love triangle with David and Ben; Harris faces her own dilemma.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to decide between David and Ben; Becky begins to doubt herself as a mom; Mark gets in trouble at school when a picture of him and his boyfriend kissing goes viral

programme.title: The Conners

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

But what Boone doesn't know is that Decker is really a serial killer. Decker frames Boone to take the fall for his murders, and Boone is killed by the police. But Boone is brought back to life by the monsters of his dreams, the Nightbreed, who in turn join Boone in his quest to stop Decker from killing again.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty adds flowers for pollinators to his wildlife garden, creates an alpine trough and plants out tender veg in his vegetable garden. Adam Frost uses the wonders of technology when comedian Susan Calman contacts him for advice with her garden in Glasgow.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on plants to use for foliage with tropical proportions, Arit Anderson continues investigating the use of peat and Carol Klein explores Oxford Botanic Garden's euphorbias.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Across the country `Gardeners' World' presenters, from their own gardens and homes, give advice and share their knowledge to enable people to get the most out of their gardens. For further inspiration, professionals, horticulturists and hobby gardeners provide fellow green-fingered enthusiasts with useful tips and suggestions, no matter the size of garden or level of expertise. Whether it is creating depth in a small, backyard garden or how to make the most of the latest spinach crop with homemade pesto, presenters prove that the possibilities are endless for any gardener and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As summer unfolds at Longmeadow, Monty Don undertakes timely tasks in his vegetable garden and flower beds. Meanwhile, Carol Klein enjoys the beauty of one of our unsung native flowers, the geum, and visits a cottage garden which holds the national collection of cultivated forms. Plus, Formula 1 supremo Sir Frank Williams explains why he is opening his garden at Inholmes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As usual, Monty is at Longmeadow where he will set out his plans for the coming year. Monty reviews the effects the winter weather has had on his garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring gets well underway, Monty Don adds to his collection of fritillaries at Longmeadow with pot-grown plants, as well as sowing some from seed. He also recommends other wildflowers which would thrive in the garden. Carol Klein meets Matt Bishop, who explains why he is attracted to later flowering varieties of daffodils and Rachel de Thame shows a viewer how to get to grips with pruning an overgrown shrubbery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals plans for a new raised seating area, surrounded by wild flowers. Carol looks at the blossom at Battsford Arboretum in the Cotswolds and now the risk of frosts should have passed, Monty plants beans and courgettes in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty is planning for next summer by sowing a batch of sweet peas. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is amongst the leaves, bark and berries at Thorp Perrow Arboretum in Yorkshire admiring the onset of the autumn display. Plus, there's a visit to Ryton Gardens in Warwickshire to find out about their collection of heritage vegetables and how to collect their seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As summer unfolds at Longmeadow, Monty Don undertakes timely tasks in his vegetable garden and flower beds. Meanwhile, Carol Klein enjoys the beauty of one of our unsung native flowers, the geum, and visits a cottage garden which holds the national collection of cultivated forms. Plus, Formula 1 supremo Sir Frank Williams explains why he is opening his garden at Inholmes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Arit Anderson and Frances Tophill visit Wakehurst, Kew's wild botanic garden in Sussex. They not only explore the gardens but also meet the gardeners, joining in on their planting projects and finding out more about the UK's largest conservation project, the Millenium Seed Bank.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty turns his attention to containers, planting them up for drama and summer colour in the jewel garden and showing us how to repot citrus plants. In Hampshire, Joe Swift meets the designer of an award-winning contemporary garden to explore the techniques and the plants she has used to seamlessly integrate both house and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As midsummer approaches, it's the perfect time for Monty to place succulents outside at Longmeadow, as well as planting out dahlias and tender vegetables. Carol Klein visits Trebah Garden in Cornwall, where she finds plants which can add early summer pazazz to our borders. Nick Bailey is at RHS Wisley to look at a variety of shrubs that can be used as alternatives to traditional box hedging. We travel to the seaside in Kent to meet a group of gardeners who have transformed a public space.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Join Adam Frost in his garden, where he will be giving tips on laying turf, planting succulents and adding perennial plants to his kitchen garden to grow as cut flowers. Joe Swift travels to Marwood Hill Gardens in Devon to explore plants that thrive in moist conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost adds tall plants for shady conditions to his borders, demonstrates how to make a window box for growing vegetables and herbs, and gives his tips on how to grow plants successfully in peat-free compost.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty catches up with all his summer jobs in the border and the vegetable garden. Carol gets inspiration for planting combinations at Cothay Manor and Gardens, and Arit learns about slugs and snails.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has advice on how to successfully store an apple crop so it will last through winter and explains why he thinks it high time wall flowers came back into fashion. With tomatoes now over, Monty clears his greenhouse and plans for next year by planting garlic in the vegetable garden. Meanwhile, Carol is home at Glebe Cottage, dividing her perennials to continue the cost-effective stocking of her new beds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets his new vegetable garden underway by making raised beds. He also offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of the death of William Shakespeare when he investigates the fact and the fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons, at the Chelsea Physic Garden; and we visit Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of over 25,000 tulips.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles seasonal jobs at Longmeadow and plants clematis in his cottage garden. Rachel de Thame takes a walk down memory lane when she visits the world's biggest flower garden in Holland and Carol Klein is on the trail of early plant hunters, responsible for the glorious selection of magnolias brought to these shores.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: A truck driver from Wakefield with a passion for flowers wants to create a perfect outside space for his girlfriend and burgeoning family, while in Swindon a widow wants to find the best way of turning her bleak patch of green into a cottage garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty travels to two corners of the country where the challenges he faces are very different. On the south coast he is presented with a front garden ravaged by salty winds, and in Snowdonia he helps a mountainside garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty helps two families create dream gardens that are as much for the children as for the adults. In Doncaster, Nikki and John want a garden full of edible plants and fruit.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the Gardeners' World team look back at the horticultural highs of the latest series and celebrate the very best inspirational gardens and gardeners up and down the country.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the Gardeners' World team look back at the horticultural highlights from the latest series and celebrate the very best inspirational gardens and gardeners up and down the country.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: British summer time means that, from Saturday, we all have an extra hour to get out in our gardens in the evenings just as the early spring display is coming into its own. At Longmeadow, Monty Don introduces us to the coppice, a woodland area where his favourite flower, the primrose, is in bloom. As well as enjoying the seasonal colours of spring, it's time to plan the summer display. Monty sows sweet peas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don looks ahead to the long Easter weekend by cutting back his grass borders. Meanwhile, Joe Swift reveals his top tips for creating a natural garden, and Carol Klein travels to Cornwall in search of a garden full of spring colour. Plus, the `living catalogue' of new and existing varieties of bedding plants at Ball Colegrave in Banbury, Oxfordshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Earlier in the year Monty put aside a patch of his garden to grow his own cut flowers and this week he returns to assess the results and harvest his first crop of colourful blooms. We pay a visit to an organic flower farm to find out how, from seed to harvest, the process of growing plays a large part in improving well-being.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first signs of spring herald the start of the new gardening year. Monty Don reveals the changes he has made to his garden over the winter, tackles timely pruning tasks and shows the best way to lay a new path. Meanwhile, snowdrops are lighting up the winter garden and Carol Klein is out and about in Oxfordshire celebrating their staggering diversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty gives a masterclass on the summer pruning of fruit, gives advice on maintaining ponds and plants up a pot to give colour and interest to last into the autumn months. Adam Frost travels to Brodsworth Hall in South Yorkshire to meet a head gardener who has been set the challenge of restoring the gardens to their 19th century glory.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: With rods bent and fish in the box, Capt. Josh and Alex Fogg reel in a variety of species to assist with important research on fish growth and population health.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Capt Josh and Johnny from Johnny Jigs head out with gorgeous weather on their side to hit some reefs and put the jigs to work!

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Captain Josh and the fam head out to do some surf fishing to see what’s biting. Then ended the day building professional sand castles and playing goofy golf.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As the SoCal Bluefin Tuna fishing season begins to take shape, Ali and Rush head out to fish the waters of San Diego and see what new surprises may be in store for them this year. For many boats in the fleet, the heading turns to the south for a visit to the commercial tuna pen operation that often attracts other fish from miles away. It's parking lot fishing at its best, but with a change in technique and break from the crowd Ali puts Rush on the bite!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush takes up an invite from good friend and fellow guide Jared Cyr to sight fish for barracuda and bonefish in the shallow waters of the Florida Keys. Meanwhile Rush's boat takes a break from charter fishing to get a new Seakeeper RIDE system installed.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: After a great trip fishing the flats, Rush returns the favor and extends an invite to friend Jarred Cyr fishing offshore. Fishing in Key West is all about the variety of species and opportunities they present. Mixing it up and taking advantage of this, the guys decide to see how many species they can catch using light spin and fly tackle offshore.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The LK crew returns to Guatemala with more friends for our yearly dose of world class fishing! Year after year, Casa Vieja Lodge continues to impress with daily shots at sailfish, marlin, mahi, and tuna. Tag along on our 2nd annual group trip for a tropical fishing experience like no other!

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor meet up with Captain Nick LaBadie at Big Pine Key for an action packed day on the flats chasing tarpon, bonefish and permit for the elusive grand slam.

programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor launch out of Key Largo and fish their way up a creek filled with monsters.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: Our final show highlights some of the best diving of the year.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway original presenter Tina Dalton joins us on a voyage of discovery to the Falkland Islands, South Georgia and the wondrous white continent of Antarctica.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway, Tina Dalton continues her voyage across the Southern Ocean from Antarctica to South Georgia, the pinnacle of wildlife experiences on the planet, before visiting the remote Falkland Islands.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff team up with their friends from Boss Shotshells in South Dakota for a high-energy upland hunt, pursuing wild pheasants with the help of skilled hunting dogs. The adventure takes a quirky turn with a visit to the iconic Corn Palace.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny meets up with Jeff Coffee of ZOE angling group to talk shop, tie flies and fish in one of the most biodiverse lakes in the country.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: In Valle de Elqui, Chile, the Canihuante family and their community have banded together to combat the harmful effects of long-standing mining practices in the region. Their mission: convince the Chilean government to permanently protect the Cochiguaz River, a vital resource for locals and myriad fauna and flora that depend on its water for survival.

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: Few freshwater species are more steeped in lore than North America's native muskellunge. Sporting the nickname "The fish of ten thousand casts," musky remains unchecked on the bucket list of many casual and committed anglers. Spencer Berman caught and landed his first "by accident," a fortuitous but ultimately fateful encounter. "I got bit by the musky bug at a young age," he says, and it appears the bug is alive and well. “It drives me to be better, do better, fish longer, work harder, put more into it, do more prep work, to check each and every component. I’m forever and always willing to make ‘one more cast.”

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: From country music star Brian Kelley’s big 56’ Sunny Briggs Sportfishing Yacht, to getting caught in a storm aboard a small Hurricane deck boat in the Gulf of Mexico, this episode of Stomping Grounds has host Ryan McVinney exploring boat culture in Florida’s Panhandle region, from the Emerald Coast to The Big Bend and the Forgotten Coast. Brian Kelley, aka “Beach Cowboy”, or BK for short, makes up one half of the country music group Florida Georgia Line (FGL) and has just released his own solo album Sunshine State of Mind. Kelley invites viewers aboard his vessel the “Brittney Marie” which was named after his wife, for a look at the couple’s Stomping Grounds. Songs from his album play on the boat’s sound system - including a tune about shopping for a boat on Boat Trader

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark is still on the South Island of New Zealand chasing the Wingshooting Slam. It’s Mark's last day to complete the waterfowl portion of the slam and he still needs a Black Swan and a Shoveler. This hunt is taking place on a freshwater lake right off the ocean. The temperature is unusually warm for this time of year, but thankfully that hasn’t affected the numbers of birds around.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is south of the border in Veracruz, Mexico going after a Mexican Gulf Coast Whitetail. When the whitetail action slowed down, Mark tried his luck at a spot-and stalk hunt for White-lipped Peccary. With hot temps, Mark and company try to find water that the Peccary will be targeting to stay hydrated.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: In this episode of Goin' Coastal, Captain Josh and Anna Calhoon set out for some fun Flounder fishing. They enjoy a delicious hook & cook served up fresh from their day at AJ's!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: John Sewell has played a huge part in the development of feeding Fortified Cottonseed 365 days a year. Laramie Barrett of Fortified Cottonseed joins John for a great weekend of hunting at his ranch in Uvalde, Texas. This is a great time for Laramie to get away from the office and see the first hand of how their product is performing.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed today to hunt with Cole Dutton for the Inaugural Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. We are honored to spend a weekend with Cole and his family at the G2 Ranch. Disabled Outdoorsman has played a huge part in getting those less fortunate outdoors. We are truly blessed to be able to follow along and capture these great moments.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Cable is a huge supporter of Texas Hunting and everything Teas Trophy Hunters. We are blessed to spend a few days with hum at the beautiful Saddle Creek Ranch in Brady Texas. Greg has a tight management plan and we are glad we got to enjoy his ranch with him and his team.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchester’s best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team follows the project of a detailed retrofitting of a Bertram upgrading from one motor to twin engines with the help of an Armstrong Bracket. The team then heads to Boatwrench Inc. to rebuild the carburetor for the Glastron project.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team does a deep dive into a product founded by Engineered Marine Coatings called the Genius Bucket. The Genius Bucket being the ultimate DIY paint kit for those looking to tackle a marine painting job on there own. The team also checks out the capabilities it takes to restoring the older metal rub rail which derived from the Glastron project.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, hunting season swiftly coming to an end. Withthe real estate world getting busier, Slade and his family set outto fill some tags, and fill up the freezer. It’s time to go on a DoePatrol!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: The 2024 turkey season has arrived. Slade and Bentley are already off to a great start. Bentley managed to take one down opening weekend for youth hunt. And Slade took one down opening day. This episode features an inside look into Slade’s life filled with real eastate and the great outdoors.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: PCB’s white sand beaches are jam-packed with visitors soaking up sunand surf while Justin and Meredith chase schools of migrating tarponjust offshore. How often do those two worlds collide?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: While releasing a defeated tarpon healthy after an epic battle is the ultimate victory, everything else is measured in heartbreak and degrees of failure. For Justin, putting Ethan on his first silver king requires patience and a tasty diversion by a local chef.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith learns the value of the Trash Can Slam on a flounder trip withCapt. Justin that turns into a multi-species challenge.”

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin Leake and Meredith McCord divert attention from what’s not happening with the tarpon bite to using CoastMaster, light tackle and experience to find snapper success on heavily fished public spots.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: After several years of shifting focus back to his native whitetails, Dahlke returns to mule deer country with the Muley Freak, Erik Van Woerkom. Follow along on this Utah mule deer hunt.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: For decades, Paul Butski has set the standard in turkey calling. His name is etched into the NWTF Grand National Calling Championships Hall of Fame, and his influence stretches far beyond the stage. He didn’t just win competitions, he shaped the way we talk to turkeys – and more importantly, the way we hunt them.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: In the wide world of western big game, pronghorn antelope hunting in Wyoming is unmatched in its accessibility and excitement. It’s an active pursuit, typically ripe with plenty of opportunities to spot and stalk black-horned bucks. This makes it an ideal forum for riflemen looking to scratch their western itch.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: The 2024 turkey season has arrived. Slade and Bentley are already off to a great start. Bentley managed to take one down opening weekend for youth hunt. And Slade took one down opening day. This episode features an inside look into Slade’s life filled with real eastate and the great outdoors.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode we take you behind the scenes of production for one of the biggest and baddest listings Slade has ever gotten - Southside Land Company in Jefferson County, MS. Hunter Phelps comes down from Kentucky to help film, and Slade puts him on 2 Mississippi gobblers.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade shows us around some of his investment properties, and Ryan kills a nice bull elk in New Mexico.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Aoudad Country Part 2- Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things hunting head to the Texas and Mexico border on a DIY Aoudad hunt where Cole is after his first Aoudad. After that Kyle teams up with good friend Chris Griffin where they head to another Ranch on the border and hunt two giant Aoudad rams with a rifles.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: It's Rifle Season in Oklahoma. Kyle Barefield and wife, Stevie Barefield are hunting the rut for big western bucks with the brand new X-Bolt 2 Rifle from Browning. A front blows in, and with the change in weather, 2 big whitetails go down.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel are on a week long mission to find the ducks in the central flyway. The weather is starting to push the ducksdown in to TX and OK but the heavy rainfall has spread them out. It takes constant scouting and adapting to the changes each day to stay on the ducks in order to shoot limits.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons goes to the magical Island nation of Malta to explore the secrets buried beneath the waters.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons goes to the magical Island nation of Malta to explore the secrets buried beneath the waters.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: It's a trip out to God's Grocery Store with country star Styles Haury ashe and Brandon look for Tuna and Snapper to bring home to the family.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon learns how to return fish caught out of deep water using a descending device, a tool that is helping conserve the fish population everywhere that it is being used.

programme.desc: Captains Jonathan Moss and Josh Greer are fishing for south Florida’s exotics amongst the alligators of the Florida Everglades.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: U.S. Marines combat correspondent Ken Plant tells of being captured and tortured as a POW.

This week we celebrate the 40th Anniversary of Lone Wolf stands and the man that started it all, the Lone Wolf himself Andrae D’Acquisto. As we take a look back at Andrae’s career, how it all started and where its heading after 4 decades, Andrae shares some insights on his hunting strategies and the equipment he has designed that made him one of the top bowhunters in the country!

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys are at the Dirty Bird in Oklahoma trying to run some trot lines on the North Canadian river but the water is just a little lower than they expected.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Rifle season is off to a slow start but things are heating up with lots of tags to fill.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys are still at the Dirty bird in Oklahoma, trying to get a few more tasks done before heading back to the Raven in Missouri. They also manage to get out and do a little velvet scouting with the Hawk spotting scope.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Join in as Randy and Cody are hard at work on the Raven Planting some Big Tine borderline on one of their favorite plots on the farm. Then learn all about their summer time clover plot maintenance routine.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are back on the Raven in Missouri and with opening day of bow season fast approaching they are scrambling to get all the final prep work done and correct any mistakes they might have made along the way.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Back at the Raven for bow camp and everything is coming together. Randy has a close encounter with one of the OG bucks on the property while Nate closes the deal on a big five year old.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Bow season is finally here and the boys are at the Dirty Bird in Oklahoma. Randy is chasing a buck he named "The Camp Buck" because of how close the buck is to camp. If Randy can get it done this will be his biggest buck to date in Oklahoma.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With two weeks until the opener of Missouri archery season, Randy and Cody are trying to do everything they can to have the Raven prepped for the first bow camp.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: In this episode of Goin' Coastal, Captain Josh and Anna Calhoon set out for some fun Flounder fishing. They enjoy a delicious hook & cook served up fresh from their day at AJ's!

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: With rods bent and fish in the box, Capt. Josh and Alex Fogg reel in a variety of species to assist with important research on fish growth and population health.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Capt Josh and Johnny from Johnny Jigs head out with gorgeous weather on their side to hit some reefs and put the jigs to work!

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Captain Josh and the fam head out to do some surf fishing to see what’s biting. Then ended the day building professional sand castles and playing goofy golf.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As the SoCal Bluefin Tuna fishing season begins to take shape, Ali and Rush head out to fish the waters of San Diego and see what new surprises may be in store for them this year. For many boats in the fleet, the heading turns to the south for a visit to the commercial tuna pen operation that often attracts other fish from miles away. It's parking lot fishing at its best, but with a change in technique and break from the crowd Ali puts Rush on the bite!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush takes up an invite from good friend and fellow guide Jared Cyr to sight fish for barracuda and bonefish in the shallow waters of the Florida Keys. Meanwhile Rush's boat takes a break from charter fishing to get a new Seakeeper RIDE system installed.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: After a great trip fishing the flats, Rush returns the favor and extends an invite to friend Jarred Cyr fishing offshore. Fishing in Key West is all about the variety of species and opportunities they present. Mixing it up and taking advantage of this, the guys decide to see how many species they can catch using light spin and fly tackle offshore.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The LK crew returns to Guatemala with more friends for our yearly dose of world class fishing! Year after year, Casa Vieja Lodge continues to impress with daily shots at sailfish, marlin, mahi, and tuna. Tag along on our 2nd annual group trip for a tropical fishing experience like no other!

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor meet up with Captain Nick LaBadie at Big Pine Key for an action packed day on the flats chasing tarpon, bonefish and permit for the elusive grand slam.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor run from Hawks Cay Resort up to Islamorada on a windy day to fish under the mangroves for Goliath grouper.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor join Captain Bryson Shaaber to fish the channels around Key West targeting big spring tarpon with live pinfish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor launch out of Key Largo and fish their way up a creek filled with monsters.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Captain Tony Young for a day of offshore fishing and free diving out of Islamorada.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head deep into the Everglades to target snook in the murky waters of Lake Ingraham.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captains Jonathan Moss and Josh Greer are fishing for south Florida’s exotics amongst the alligators of the Florida Everglades.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Follow Ali and Rush on a typical day when they are not fishing together on their respective coasts

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through the mountains of western North Carolina, where we stop in Asheville and Cashiers!!

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: Our final show highlights some of the best diving of the year.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway original presenter Tina Dalton joins us on a voyage of discovery to the Falkland Islands, South Georgia and the wondrous white continent of Antarctica.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway, Tina Dalton continues her voyage across the Southern Ocean from Antarctica to South Georgia, the pinnacle of wildlife experiences on the planet, before visiting the remote Falkland Islands.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff team up with their friends from Boss Shotshells in South Dakota for a high-energy upland hunt, pursuing wild pheasants with the help of skilled hunting dogs. The adventure takes a quirky turn with a visit to the iconic Corn Palace.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny meets up with Jeff Coffee of ZOE angling group to talk shop, tie flies and fish in one of the most biodiverse lakes in the country.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: In Valle de Elqui, Chile, the Canihuante family and their community have banded together to combat the harmful effects of long-standing mining practices in the region. Their mission: convince the Chilean government to permanently protect the Cochiguaz River, a vital resource for locals and myriad fauna and flora that depend on its water for survival.

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: Few freshwater species are more steeped in lore than North America's native muskellunge. Sporting the nickname "The fish of ten thousand casts," musky remains unchecked on the bucket list of many casual and committed anglers. Spencer Berman caught and landed his first "by accident," a fortuitous but ultimately fateful encounter. "I got bit by the musky bug at a young age," he says, and it appears the bug is alive and well. “It drives me to be better, do better, fish longer, work harder, put more into it, do more prep work, to check each and every component. I’m forever and always willing to make ‘one more cast.”

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: From country music star Brian Kelley’s big 56’ Sunny Briggs Sportfishing Yacht, to getting caught in a storm aboard a small Hurricane deck boat in the Gulf of Mexico, this episode of Stomping Grounds has host Ryan McVinney exploring boat culture in Florida’s Panhandle region, from the Emerald Coast to The Big Bend and the Forgotten Coast. Brian Kelley, aka “Beach Cowboy”, or BK for short, makes up one half of the country music group Florida Georgia Line (FGL) and has just released his own solo album Sunshine State of Mind. Kelley invites viewers aboard his vessel the “Brittney Marie” which was named after his wife, for a look at the couple’s Stomping Grounds. Songs from his album play on the boat’s sound system - including a tune about shopping for a boat on Boat Trader

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark is still on the South Island of New Zealand chasing the Wingshooting Slam. It’s Mark's last day to complete the waterfowl portion of the slam and he still needs a Black Swan and a Shoveler. This hunt is taking place on a freshwater lake right off the ocean. The temperature is unusually warm for this time of year, but thankfully that hasn’t affected the numbers of birds around.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is south of the border in Veracruz, Mexico going after a Mexican Gulf Coast Whitetail. When the whitetail action slowed down, Mark tried his luck at a spot-and stalk hunt for White-lipped Peccary. With hot temps, Mark and company try to find water that the Peccary will be targeting to stay hydrated.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: In this episode of Goin' Coastal, Captain Josh and Anna Calhoon set out for some fun Flounder fishing. They enjoy a delicious hook & cook served up fresh from their day at AJ's!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: John Sewell has played a huge part in the development of feeding Fortified Cottonseed 365 days a year. Laramie Barrett of Fortified Cottonseed joins John for a great weekend of hunting at his ranch in Uvalde, Texas. This is a great time for Laramie to get away from the office and see the first hand of how their product is performing.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed today to hunt with Cole Dutton for the Inaugural Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. We are honored to spend a weekend with Cole and his family at the G2 Ranch. Disabled Outdoorsman has played a huge part in getting those less fortunate outdoors. We are truly blessed to be able to follow along and capture these great moments.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Cable is a huge supporter of Texas Hunting and everything Teas Trophy Hunters. We are blessed to spend a few days with hum at the beautiful Saddle Creek Ranch in Brady Texas. Greg has a tight management plan and we are glad we got to enjoy his ranch with him and his team.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan.
